intro: Cynoglossum strictum, commonly known as narrowleaf honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that grows up to 60 cm tall, with erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and slightly hairy, while the flowers are blue to purple, bell-shaped, and arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and disturbed sites.
